content.title: Mukhyamantri Yuva Swavalamban Yojana
content.details: Mukhymantri Yuva Swavalamban Yojana or MYSY Scholarship is a scholarship scheme that is offered to the economically weaker section students of Gujarat. All those students who wish to pursue higher education like diploma courses, engineering, pharmacy course, medical course, etc apply for MYSY scholarship every year.
benefits: Financial assistance for buying books and equipment for non-reserve students
Financial assistance of Rs 10 lakh over 5 years for students in medical education research society and dental courses
Age relaxation of 5 years for all category students for government jobs
Assistance of Rs 1200 per month for 10 months if no higher education facility or government hostel is available
Rs 25000 per year or 50% fees (whichever is less) for students who passed class 10th and 12th with 80% and opted for diploma courses
Free outfits, reading material, etc provided by the government
eligibility: For scholarship in Diploma admissions, the candidate should have passed the Std X from a recognized board from the state of Gujarat with a minimum 80 percentile in the board examination

For scholarship in Bachelor's degree programs, the candidates should have passed Std XII Science/ General stream from a recognized board from the state of Gujarat with a minimum 80 percentile in the board examination

For Diploma to Degree students, the minimum eligibility criteria for availing the benefits of the scheme is a 65% mark at the Diploma level examination from a recognized university situated in the state of Gujarat
The candidates whose parents annual income is not more than Rs. 6,00,000/- per annum shall only be considered eligible for the said scheme
The State Government has approved the validity of the income certificate for three financial years from the date of issue
documents_required: Certificate from the institute for new students
Hostel admission letter and fee receipt

faqs.question: What is the Mukhymantri Yuva Swavalamban Yojana?
faqs.answer: It is a scholarship provided by the Gujarat Government for economically weaker students for their education.

faqs.question: Is MYSY available for Gujarat students only?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Mukhymantri Yuva Swavalamban Yojana is available only for students in Gujarat.

faqs.question: What is the Eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: For scholarship in Diploma admissions, the candidate should have passed the Std X from a recognized board from the state of Gujarat with a minimum 80 percentile in the board examination. For scholarship in Bachelor's degree programs, the candidates should have passed Std XII Science/ General stream from a recognized board from the state of Gujarat with a minimum 80 percentile in the board examination. For Diploma to Degree students, the minimum eligibility criteria for availing the benefits of the scheme is a 65% mark at the Diploma level examination from a recognized university situated in the state of Gujarat. The candidates whose parents annual income is not more than Rs. 6,00,000/- per annum shall only be considered eligible for the said scheme. The State Government has approved the validity of the income certificate for three financial years from the date of issue.

faqs.question: How to apply?
faqs.answer: Visit the official website of MYSY scholarship and follow the instructions.

faqs.question: List of required documents?
faqs.answer: Income certificate, Adhaar Card, Self-declaration form, Certificate from the institute for new students, Renewal certificate from institute, Self-declaration for non-IT returns, 10th and 12th standard mark sheet, Admission letter and fee receipt, Bank account proof, Hostel admission letter and fee receipt, Affidavit (non-judicial stamp paper Rs 20), Recent passport-size photo.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: There are three types of scholarships that are offered under the MYSY Scholarship which are as follows: Tuition fee grant, Hostel grant, Book/instruments grant.
